website_summaries.verdict: The premier name in kitchen gadgets lends its expertise to create a tasty individual cup of coffee, and at a bargain price.
pros: Don't have to pour water slowly like most drippers: add water all at once and let it do its thing
Lid can be used as a drip tray after brewing
All parts BPA-free and can be washed on top rack of dishwasher
cons: Makes up to a 12-ounce cup, so may not be large enough for some users

customer_reviews.title: Four and a half star worthy.
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely constructed single serve drip coffee maker. My only complaint (- 1star) is that the dispersion holes in the reservoir are a bit too centered and do not direct water to the outer ring of coffee in the filter. I find I have to remove the reservoir and pour a little hot water around the edge to wet all of the coffee. As with most single serve drip units I find I have to add a little more coffee for a decent cup verses a multi cup brewer (1 scoop per 6oz). Otherwise really a great unit, would downgrade just a half star if I could.
customer_reviews.author: H.B.R.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around a good bit to find a single serve drip to replace the french press I'd used for a couple of years but had grown tired of dealing with the french press process. This OXO Good Grips Single Serve is an absolute jewel! The drip is pretty fast but results in a perfect cup of coffee with nothing left to clean that requires more than a quick rinse! Since I've only used the french press for ages, I had no filters on hand when the OXO arrived and was tickled to find that there were quite a few cone filters included in the package! Still loving this thing after several months of use!
customer_reviews.author: dinahsgoatmilksoaps

customer_reviews.title: Makes A Good Cup
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the simplest things work really well and this one does. I can use a cone filter or my leftover bunch of unbleached coffee filters. A couple of scoops (like mine dark) and sit it on your cup, put the clear plastic guy on top, and pour in hot water from my electric kettle. It lightly drips water onto the grounds so you don't have to stand there. I walk away for a few minutes and done. Makes a great cup of coffee and doesn't take that long. I have used 200° hot water and have no problems, have not put into dishwasher, no need, just hand wash.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Makes pour over single cup coffee very simple
customer_reviews.text: This brewer makes pour-over coffee simple. No worries about measuring your water because the lines are clearly marked. It's inexpensive on top of it. The only negative I would have to say is that the holes are close together so the grounds don't always seem evenly saturated. The coffee turns out full-flavored and it's quick and easy. Check out the how to video!
customer_reviews.author: LaneM

customer_reviews.title: Works a lot better than my Melita cone that I have been using ...
customer_reviews.text: Works a lot better than my Melita cone that I have been using for years........Sorry that I did not get into this one sooner......The water transition into the grounds can absorb more coffee flavor with the placement and size of the holes in the water reservoir......
customer_reviews.author: George R. Banks

customer_reviews.title: All this hype about plastic and contamination not if it was a good buy
customer_reviews.text: This project is Plastic and when he hits plastic I wonder if I’m getting contamination from this plastic I don’t know if it’s BPA free I hope so it’s OK it has a funny taste and if I could return it I would
customer_reviews.author: Shirin

customer_reviews.title: Great item for a minimalist kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I try very hard to keep a minimalist kitchen with as few appliances as possible. This makes a great cup of pourover coffee, takes up very little space, and is a snap to clean and put away. Nothing to plug in, no glass that could break, and I can just boil water in the pot I already keep on the stove. It is really as simple as making a cup of tea using loose tea. I have owned a couple of similar models in the past, and the water reservoir included with this one makes this a far superior design. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not original filters....Seller is cheating customers
customer_reviews.text: This reseller is duping people. They are using the original boxes and stuffing them with copy cat filters that are much smaller and are of poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Veritatis

customer_reviews.title: Time-saver
customer_reviews.text: Nice to be able to fill the reservoir and go about other tasks. Some reviews talk about the little holes being different sizes. That's true for mine, but it works just fine. As a data point, I grind my coffee as fine as the grinder allows, and I like it nice and strong. I do wet the grounds a little bit just before placing the reservoir on top and filling it. Don't know if that makes a difference, but it just seems like a good idea. I haven't noticed any change in my brew compared to the old way of doing a slow pour-over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware your cup’s dimensions!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is well made and functions well...if I had the correct coffee mug. I brew my pour-over coffee directly into my Hydroflask mug. Unfortunately, my mug opening diameter is exactly the same as the bottom lip of the Oxo brewer (2.25”)! As a result, the brewer will not rest stable on top of the mug. As you can see, the brewer can easily tip over. See attached images. The set-up is quite precarious when the reservoir is full of hot water. I solved the problem by making a hybrid product by using my old brewer and the new Oxo water reservoir. Just beware of your cup’s dimensions!
customer_reviews.author: Kemin Tsung

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pour the correct amount of water
customer_reviews.text: The best part of this dripper is that I can pour in exactly how much water I need to make the amount of coffee I want, allowing for the absorption of some of the water, using the measurement markings on the top reservoir. Then I wait for it to slowly seep through the grounds.Some have commented that not all the holes were open. Maybe mine are, maybe not, but when I watch the hot water dripping on the grounds it looks like it is evenly distributed. Then it is easy to toss the filter and grounds. If you want really hot coffee you may have to microwave the finished cup for a little bit. But it is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: ASF

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I've been using a cone/drip for my coffee for years, but constantly struggle with getting the water to grounds ratio perfect. This dripper makes it so much easier! I can better control the amount of water I'm using and the slow drip over the grounds makes for a better balanced cup of coffee. If you wanted, you could also use the cone without the water reservoir. I am very happy with much purchase and don't know why I waited so long to order!
customer_reviews.author: EMG

customer_reviews.title: The holes in the reservoir don’t drip properly.
customer_reviews.text: The tank doesn’t drip properly, only half of the holes drip so it takes forever to make a cup of coffee 😑 it’s unfortunate because it’s a great idea but the execution is less than great.
customer_reviews.author: seattlemagic

customer_reviews.title: im addicted to pour over coffee now
customer_reviews.text: I hated using a coffee pot because the coffee always tasted so bad and I would make too much and then it would be wasted. This solves all my problems. I boil water, make one incredible cup of coffee while I shower, get out of the shower and I have a perfect cup of coffee without waste. Its sooo worth it!
customer_reviews.author: McKay Montz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Terrible cup of coffee. Followed directions & filled water to 10ounce cup & it barely made 1/2 cup that looked like mud. Don’t bother, back to my trusty Faberware electric where you get a great cup of HOT coffee that stays hot, what was I thinking!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Perrucci

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup!
customer_reviews.text: Coffee is life. Over the years I've been trying to find a way to make good coffee without breaking the bank. My old school drip maker was ok but coffee tastes burnt after sitting in the carafe for an hour or so. The Keurig just makes garbage coffee. French press doesnt have a smooth finish (imo). THIS little thing makes a good cup of coffee. I "brew" hot water in my old drip machine so it is on hand when I want to use this pour over cup. I use coffeehouse grounds from the grocery store. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Could NOT be any easier!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST coffee making process I have ever used! Not only does this provide you with the purify of the pour over method, but it is also fast and easy. Perfect for making pour over coffee on work days! I also love the easy cleanup. Brew your coffee, and throw away the compostable, unbleached filter, rinse all the parts, and you're done and on your way! My only negative point is the fact that this does not fit over all coffee cups. It pretty much only fits over standard sized cups. I have a few larger coffee mugs and the top part does not fit over them. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, makes a great cup of coffee. I love the top that gradually drips the water over the coffee so I don't have to watch it and continue to pour. Makes a great cup of coffee! I actually use it at my desk at work because the coffee at the office should be a crime. So far, it has fit over every cup I've used it with. I would definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin - TN

customer_reviews.title: Must have for pour over lovers
customer_reviews.text: This is a miracle worker. Without it, the coffee creeps up the side of the filter after the water is poured in, or you have to stand there and pour the water a little at a time. With this product, you can fill the reservoir all the way up (12 oz) and walk away, and the water slowly trickles so that the coffee stays on the bottom of the filter for max flavor. I have a 16 oz Stanley coffee mug, which is a great travel mug, and I just wait a minute then add the 4 extra ounces, using the guide marks.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Specific filters required
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I didn’t realize it required specific filters made to fit it. So there is an extra cost after you make 5 cups of coffee. The filters don’t fit well either. If you’re looking for an easy simple product this isn’t it.
customer_reviews.author: JessieMN

customer_reviews.title: Brewed just right for my taste
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes coffee brewed from a coffeemaker just doesn't satisfy the tastebuds. This single serve dripper was easy to use and I really love using the auto drip water tank! I don't have to stand and constantly pour the water into the cone. It also has water level guides so you can put in as much water needed for that good cup of coffee. I actually use it for my travel mug, no guessing if the mug is ready to go or not. I'm sure there are better ones out there but for the price I would highly recommend. BTW, I do not give out 5 stars on any products unless it walks on water (ha, ha, ha).
customer_reviews.author: MarikoInUSA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a quick single cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is huge improvement over the old single cup Melitta coffee drip cone. It's a very smart design with the lid, that helps keep the water hot while infusing, doubling as a drip catcher after your coffee is made. Although it was really a consideration for me, I'd say this is a nicely designed product that looks good if you leave it out on the counter. It cleans easily with a rinse, and the finish and clarity of the plastic has held up well under many trips through the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: Good morning coffee cone!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for single cup brewing, this is a really well designed and well made little item. Yes, it's all plastic, but I can not detect any off flavors and it is BPA free. It takes a little trial and error to get the correct amount of water because the water starts flowing through immediately, but it's so much more convenient to be able to pour all the water in at once. The design of the cone and the holes allow for the perfect flow rate and water drip distribution. One pour and you're done. The cap helps with heat retention, then acts as a coaster for the cone. Easy to clean. Well priced. A true five star product.
customer_reviews.author: bona fide shopper

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well designed product. I like that you can pour in all the water you need in one operation and get the right amount every time. Also, the small holes at the bottom of the reservoir control the flow into the coffee grounds and distribute it more evenly than with a simple pour-over utensil. And the cover that doubles as a drip tray is a simple but useful feature.
customer_reviews.author: rochrunner

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee.  Lacks reusable filter.
customer_reviews.text: It's quite an accomplishment to make the best coffee pour over in the world! You did it! Congratulations! World's best cup of coffee! Great job, everybody! It's great to be here. It's just too bad it doesn't have a reusable filter or even an option to buy a strong mesh filter to insert into it. Constantly using paper refills is tedious, costly, and irresponsible.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: My Zojirushi finally broke. I am the only coffee drinker in the house so I thought I would try cheaper and smaller. I still can't figure out how to make a better cup of coffee than my machine. It isn't worse, but it certainly isn't better. I guess it turns out that my "cup" in the morning was preferably about 2 cups, so to get that amount you have to overfill the OXO. Super easy to clean, and it's compact, so there's that. I did not have any problems with plastic taste.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a decent cup in the field.
customer_reviews.text: This is alright, but I had assumed from a quick glance at the photos (and not a thorough read of the description) that it was composed of ceramic and glass. I was a little disappointed to find it was just different kinds of plastic. That said my biggest complaint is that the flow rate from the dripper is a bit high. I'm trying to find a reversible way to block some of the holes to slow down the flow rate and give the water more time to steep in the grounds. Of course, I realize this will mean that the water will cool more, but I suspect this is negligible if it is in a closed container.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Slide Rule

customer_reviews.title: a clever idea, but doesn't really pay off
customer_reviews.text: well, it sorta works as claimed, but a) the time saved is minimal for me, b) it seems to use more coffee to get the same strength cup as the end result, vs pour over, c) the instructions skip the blooming step, and d) the end result was simply weaker less tasty coffee using more grounds (even when I did pre-dampen the grounds slightly). Eh. I put it in the goodwill pile after 2 days of trying it out. A simple pour over made better coffee using a smaller amount of ground beans. So, at least for me, this fails. Good design in many respects, but the end result wasn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: FBT

customer_reviews.title: This is the single-cup coffee solution you want
customer_reviews.text: I'm the only coffee drinker in the house, so a full coffee pot takes up more space than it should. The french press (though it's wonderful on lazy mornings) takes too much time to make and to clean, and I was getting tired of mediocre instant coffee. This pour-over is perfect: very quick and easy, very easy to clean, and like typical OXO products, it's done right: the lid/trivet is so much more useful than I thought it would be. And the cup itself only has one hole at the bottom so it drains through slowly and you get a nice, strong coffee. I'm a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I gave up the K-Cup coffeemaker in an effort to do my part to reduce single use plastic and needed a new coffee maker. I read the reviews on Amazon written by "coffee people" who raved about the flavor from the Oxo Brew and it turns out they were right. Even ice coffee flavor is robust! If I may add my "two cents" I wet the paper filter first and doing that eliminates the "papery taste" The time to make the cup of coffee is not an issue as I just do other things while the water is heating or the coffee is brewing. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Zenster

customer_reviews.title: Going back
customer_reviews.text: Poor design and holes manufactured so narrow water won’t drip through. Upper reservoir will not hold enough water for a 10 ounce mug.
customer_reviews.author: From The Tree House

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Effective & Portable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pour-over setup just over a year ago to use in a very small RV. I like it so much, I bring it in the house when I'm not traveling. I've used other pour-over setups, various drip designs and even an inherited percolator. The addition of an "engineered" drip tank is a real improvement. I highly recommend this OXO for taste, convenience and durability.
customer_reviews.author: G. Williams

customer_reviews.title: LEAKY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to use at my desk at work. Several times I heard it dripping into my large mug and went to refill with water. The filters suck down on the drip hole and clog it up, thus the upper tank over flows and goes everywhere. I've never had this problem with my Melitta. I should have known to stay with a good product. Don't buy this if you want a large mug of coffe without a mess or a burn.
customer_reviews.author: "Leaf in the Wind"

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the usual unit, just the bit that sits on the cup, but was dissatisfied with having to be so careful pouring the water over it! When I want just one cup of coffee it is so much more environmentally friendly to use this than my nifty espresso machine and its pods-don't get me wrong, I love my morning espresso, but I savor that "short cup of caffeine deliciousness, usually use a coffee maker for my cup of coffee on the go. This is perfect for that coffee on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystalsea

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After my last espresso machine gave up the ghost, I decided on a more individual and smaller footprint option for coffee making. After reading the reviews I decided this was the one It is easy to use, easy to clean. I actually can use espresso grind coffee without problems (not sure if this is a good/ bad thing) without loss of flavor The most difficult problem initially was finding #2 filters at a reasonable price (was cutting "custom" ones with a square paper coffee filter (I think it was some Chemex product) Works well for a single person needing a good tasting coffee without much fuss
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Beefy

customer_reviews.title: Love it, love it, love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pour-over coffeemaker. I have used others, but this one tops them all - easy to use, easy to clean and great flavorful coffee. Love the ounce measurements on side of the topper, and the lid on top keeps the water hot while it is dripping and doubles as a tray to set the topper on when coffee brewing is complete. What an awesome design.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyday normal use
customer_reviews.text: I use this for everyday morning coffee except when I use an electric drip coffeemaker for having folks over. Much better for me than the electric single brewers because there is no environmental impact other than the paper filter. Only complaint -- and why I only rated it a 4 -- is that I have to use paper filters, which slightly taint the coffee taste. Wish there was a metal filter option for this style.
customer_reviews.author: HouTexPaul

customer_reviews.title: Pour-over has come of age
customer_reviews.text: Past excursions into pour-over generated lots of grounds in the cup. This model has overcome that. My last one-cup coffee maker started "retaining water" despite deep cleaning, and it seems like a waste to use that much electricity for one person, so I thought I would try this one. I use 10 oz water in the microwave with 2:20 cooking time in a Pyrex cup. I use a well-rounded scoop of coffee in a #2 Melitta natural brown filter.
customer_reviews.author: Renard

customer_reviews.title: Very durable...easy to travel with.
customer_reviews.text: I like the pour over idea with the water reservoir on top. Oz & ml measurements on each side. The only thing I wished is that the water can stay in the filter longer to get the true flavor of the coffee grinds. I feel the water filters through too fast. I just pour the water directly into the filter and stir the coffee grinds as much as I can before the coffee pours into the cup. The plastic is durable and hasn’t stained from the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: EGCox

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical but decided to give this a try. Can I make a better pourover? Yes. I can also make a worse pourover. This thing will make a decent pourover every single time. Best part: I don't really have to work that hard at it. I wet the filter, put my ground coffee in and then pour water into the water basin. Easiest pourover ever! Cleanup is so much easier too. I will use this at work and save the technical pourover for home when I have the time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Treto

customer_reviews.title: Super single-cup brewer
customer_reviews.text: I've searched for years for the solution to brewing a single cup. Started with a small drip brewer (too much counter space), switched to a french press (great coffee but a pain to clean), bypassed Keurig completely ($$$), even tried single Via packets (also too expensive), before finding this little gem. Brews a single cup quickly, simple construction, super easy to clean, packs away nicely when not in use, doesn't need special coffee, and doesn't cost a fortune. And the taste is great. (Although, in all honesty, I think the french press made a slightly better-tasting cup of coffee, but the trade-off for ease of use was worth it to me.) I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MAA

customer_reviews.title: Taste is comparable to an Aeropress with less effort
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a simple one-cup coffee solutions that produces coffee flavor similar to a french press or upside-down Aeropress. The french press tastes fantastic, but cleanup is a pain. And I love the aeropress using the upside-down technique, but this has the potential for creating a mess if its knocked over or the filter shifts. OXO pour over beats them both -- ridiculously simple to use, ridiculously easy to clean. My wife started to use it over the k-cups! it's that easy.
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my office which is easier than having a kettle and spending some time on the pour. This server will do it for you. The coffee is 80-90% of what you get from pouring yourself with a gooseneck kettle. The downside is the holes on mine are not perfect like the one in the picture, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: khaled almutairi

customer_reviews.title: Great Design. Nothing Fancy. Great Cup of Coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This very inexpensive completely unpretentious device has a brilliant design that works extremely well to make a great cup of coffee very quickly. You can't mess it up because it's nice thick plastic. What is not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Jerser008Roxxor

customer_reviews.title: Brews an excellent cup
customer_reviews.text: With so many things already taking up counter space I was looking for an option that would make drip coffee but without taking much room. Size 2 coffee filters that I can purchase at my local trader joes for two bucks for a hundred. It fits over my vacuum sealed cups, regular Mugs, and even a few oddly shaped cups. Coffee tastes clean and most importantly it piping hot! I plan on giving some of these away as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: O Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works good. The only improvement I can think of is that it would be nice if they had a non-plastic version.
customer_reviews.author: CaliGirl

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pour-over kit. The clear reservoir helps drip the water into the grounds in a measured way, unlike with the Melitta pour-over cone. The Oxo doesn't let the water build up in the cone, so the coffee is stronger and there is less mess. It even comes with a handy reference card to help measure out the proportions of water and grounds correctly.
customer_reviews.author: jqr

customer_reviews.title: Gift - well loved
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband. He is mainly using the upper clear portion with another pour over (funnel) he has - they work together nicely. The size of the pour over (funnel) portion with OXO is very large, likely would serve two cups easily. So he prefers a smaller version - but the top part of the OXO is wonderful, it has little holes that help gently distribute water over the grounds - improving the results. -- would be great if they sold the sections seperately too .
customer_reviews.author: Tina Amberg

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the office
customer_reviews.text: We have the OXO On Barista Brain coffee maker at home and throughly enjoy how fantastic our coffee tastes. I do believe it is because of the "showerhead" which evenly disperses the water over the grounds. This lovely unit does the same. Easy to use, quick clean up, I keep it on my desk and am able to make a great cop of coffee at work. I love Pike from Starbucks and use one of their mugs with this, (which is perfect!).
customer_reviews.author: 99riverview

customer_reviews.title: Love the OXO brewer!
customer_reviews.text: Sent back the Bonavita immersion ceramic brewer for this.. As much as I wanted to like the Bonavita I did not care for the taste of coffee it produced and also the weak lever to open and close. Also you have to time the Bonavita. With the OXO you use the water tank and just let it go until it finishes brewing. Good, quick cup of coffee without the plastic waste or awful taste of K-cups.
customer_reviews.author: D. Parish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee made easy.
customer_reviews.text: Really takes the trouble out of pour over coffee, and makes a great cup everytime. If I am using a really good bean or have the extra time I still do the traditional methods of slowly adding water by hand. To be clear that will get you a superior cup of coffee to using the drip. However it isn't always practical to take 10 minutes out to do that, and this has supplanted all other methods for my morning coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Makai

customer_reviews.title: Works but weak flavor extraction.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and easy to clean. However the flavor extraction, with a regular drip grind, is very poor. You must use twice the coffee, wet the grounds so they do not wash to the side, or pour through twice. The tank is a nice tough. I wonder if a conical versus wedge filter design would extract more flavor? If you like a more robust coffee flavor this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: DCG

customer_reviews.title: I don’t like to spend money a lot for it anymore
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking to stop using Kcup system. I don’t like to spend money a lot for it anymore . Now I got this , it’s so great !! I love it so much! I can use great coffee for each one cup . I used a karita’s small plastic dripper long time ago , I loved it but it was very hard to clean(very bumpy) . Now this one is easy to clean , mostly I just need washing quickly with only water. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Shinono

customer_reviews.title: High quality, good design
customer_reviews.text: High quality, much better then the comparably flimsy Melitta drippers. Can be used with or without the tank. Lost a star because when new, the tanks holes do not all work, I had to poke most of then open using a toothpick. Some better quality control would be helpful. Nice to be able to fill the tank and walk away to shop on Amazon while the cup brews.
customer_reviews.author: mcerner

customer_reviews.title: Water reservoir make this great.
customer_reviews.text: I got it for camping but found it works great at home to make a quick cup of coffee to go. The water reservoir is the best feature of this coffee maker. With other pour over filters you have to keep adding water a little at a time. With this coffee maker you just fill it and walk away. And the cover keeps the water hot. My only complaint is the tank could be a bit bigger, I have to come back after a while and add another 120 ml of water to completely fill my ginormous coffee mug.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! I have not one complaint. I love pour over coffee but standing over the cone pouring hot water in as slowly as possible was difficult in that I would always burn the grounds too easily or put too much water in at once. The chamber part of this holds the hot water and very slowly drips it into the cone, slower and more controlled then I could possibly do manually. It is also so convenient to just fill the chamber, get ready for work and then come back to excellent pour over coffee. It is easy to clean and does not break or crack even with the temperature changes. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TheCaddis

customer_reviews.title: Great item!!
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered through so many cups of bitter burnt coffee from a regular coffee maker. This gadget makes a great cup of coffee very quickly. I put a cup of hot tap water in the microwave for about 3 minutes to boil. While that is going I put the filter in and use four level tablespoons of coffee grounds in the filter. Once the water is hot enough I pour it into the clear measuring part at top and put the lid on and the coffee is ready to drink within 3 minutes usually. I appreciated that this item came with some filters as well. Mine had at least 15 filters which is more than advertised.
customer_reviews.author: KDee

customer_reviews.title: This is worth its weight in gold. So simple!
customer_reviews.text: So So So much better than regular drip cones. Just pour to the line you want, wait a minute, done. No standing around watching it, pouring more water in, forgetting how much you poured, flooding the counter... (Imagine me as the “before” actor on an infomercial, and the announcer gives me this, and my life is changed. It’s that good :))
customer_reviews.author: J. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great cup of coffee! We ditched our coffee maker about 9 months ago and won't go back. After sharing a pour over for a few months I ordered a second. The design is well thought out and easy to clean. Allows for easy by the cup customization...size, strength, and add-ins. After brewing, l use the lid as a coaster for the pour over to keep the counter clean. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: s0mthinels

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Instead of getting a goose neck kettle and standing there and pouring it slowly, this dripper you can fill and walk away. The water slowly drips down on the grounds, and the cover keeps the heat in. It is well made, easy to clean, and does not affect the flavor of the coffee. I think the slow drip actually enhances the coffee flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee from the cheapest coffee maker out there
customer_reviews.text: Great cup of coffee from the cheapest coffee maker out there...who knew? I broke my old Krups drip maker's carafe and grabbed this Oxo to use. Had bought this to be a present for a friend. (Got him another one.) I am still playing with the grind, but with this little machine you can taste all those little differences, so it's worth the time. I am now addicted to this OXO and the coffee from a nearby small-batch roaster who buys coffee direct from growers. This is the way to start the day.
customer_reviews.author: MBS

customer_reviews.title: Coffee has plastic taste
customer_reviews.text: Even though at least one reviewer mentioned the plastic taste of the coffee, I chose to ignore the comment because I've always had good luck with Oxo products. Sorry to say that is not the case this time. I tried numerous cups of coffee with this product hoping the off-flavor would go away, but it never did.
customer_reviews.author: gardengal

customer_reviews.title: Wow, great surprise.  Better than a lot of coffee makers.
customer_reviews.text: First, barely fits the 4" mouth on my coffee cup - but good enough. I used extra fine grind espresso roast packed lightly. No bitterness and far better strength than I expected. I don't like coffee pods at all and this is a quick alternative giving a great cup of coffee. Will be used daily. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. I typically only make one cup of coffee a day and I prefer ground over instant, so that maker is perfect. It's very easy to use on all my mugs and quick to clean up afterward. I've been using it daily for about two weeks now and it's wonderful. I love not having to pull out the big coffee maker just for one little cup.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee at any price
customer_reviews.text: I now own two of these. Coffee with this is better than any drip machine. I have Breville machine, and used to use the awesome Bunn MCU, both great (especially the Bunn), but the coffee out of these is just better. Simple to use. I don't worry about temperature. Just electric kettle, boil water, let sit for 20 seconds, pour into the reservoir, wait a minute, done. No moving parts, cheap, simple, easy and more than anything else phenomenal coffee. Benefits of single serve, no K cups, pods, etc.
customer_reviews.author: middleagedman

customer_reviews.title: Probably the safest and most convenient way to brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: Probably the safest and most convenient way to consistently brew pour-over coffee. Using the lid keeps the brew at just the right temperature after a 4 minute brew time. One possible convenience improvement I’d like to see is a simple timer/alarm, perhaps built into the lid. Great idea, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula Costa

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Best cup of coffee I’ve had in a long time. My old auto drip started running too hot, creating burnt and acidic coffee. I decided I needed something different and began scouring amazon when i came across this OXO pour over brewer. It mimicking pour over coffee without having to stand there doing it. Keeps my coffee hot until I grab it ached a few minutes. Extremely smooth and not acidic at all. Love it. Don’t think I’ll ever go back.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Rainmaker
customer_reviews.text: My old beat up red plastic cone finally bit the dust so I was going to buy one of those ceramic ones until I saw this. Boy, am I glad I gave this a shot because it's makes a great cup of coffee and I couldn't be happier! Excellent purchase! I love how the water comes out like rain over the coffee grounds!
customer_reviews.author: B. Bavaro

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased one a few months ago because of the auto dipper cup. It's very convenient because I like a large cup of coffee so I don't have to wait to re-pour more water after the initial pour. This was a gift to my nephew. He loved the clear taste of drip coffee and how easy it was to use.
customer_reviews.author: heatlhy living

Plus I like more control of where the water hits the grounds. Interesting idea that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Grether

customer_reviews.title: Easiest coffee zen experience you will find
customer_reviews.text: Produces the best daily reproducible cup of coffee I have ever had. The reservoir makes a high end cup of coffee possible without being “that guy” who has the $500 grinder, temperature controlled swan necked hot water kettle... This system provides 99% of the flavor and experience without being “that guy”. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: ... coffee maker for a couple of months now and like it better each time I use it
customer_reviews.text: Been using the coffee maker for a couple of months now and like it better each time I use it. Takes only a few minutes to use and fresh hot coffee steaming in my favorite cup! Hardest thing to clean up is tossing the filter into the kitchen trash! A quick rinse and ready for the next cup! Wish I had found this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: beeperbeak

customer_reviews.title: LOVE.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite way to brew coffee. Smoother taste vs french press, easier than regular pour over, looks nicer and easier to clean than my auto drip. Perfect. I travel with it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: A good cup in the morning
customer_reviews.text: This little brewer makes a better pour over than I do. I lose patience and dump all the water in at once. Its' nice to just set it up, heat the water, fill the tank and continue with the rest of my morning routine. I like these little pour overs because I have limited space and don't like a machine on my counter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I wanted for RV
customer_reviews.text: So, my husband makes awful coffee and when in the RV I would have to have tea or something else...I have an electric teapot, so got this and now I can make my own cup of good coffee and not have to drink the sludge in the coffee pot my husband makes... SO HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy, delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this product and would recommend to anybody looking for a quick and easy way to make an awesome cup of coffee. The tank makes it so you get the perfect amount of water and spread every time for the best extraction from your coffee. No need to worry about using a gooseneck kettle. Also, the benefit of being able to pour the water into the tank and then walk away for a few minutes can't be overstated, honestly it's my favorite part. This has quickly become my go-to coffee making method taking the place of my AeroPress. Easy to clean, just throw out the filter and grinds and quickly rinse.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Love this single server Coffee Dripper!consumer research heavily recommends it too
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on this, and it paid off. I was Cuisinart machine for years. I did tons of research & this type of making a cup of coffee won the taste tests. In particular, this OXO Brew Cofee Dripper has multiple holes in the water reservoir so the water spreads all over the coffee beans. Works wonderful, makes great coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Angela's Faves

customer_reviews.title: My coworkers think it's pretty fancy. I love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day. My coworkers think it's pretty fancy. I love it. It's easy to clean. I wish that it could make a little bit more, but I guess then I'd have to invest in a French press. This is great for a single cup.
customer_reviews.author: U & LR

customer_reviews.title: Half of them come open and spill.

customer_reviews.title: A must-have to enjoy single cup brewed coffee

I'll edit after I correctly use recommended coarse grinds.

customer_reviews.title: The best to date, of the many I have tried

customer_reviews.author: R.J. Sr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work!
customer_reviews.text: This is super easy to use especially in an office setting. I got this with the intention of using it at work since my French press can get too messy and I do not have time for a traditional pour over. This does it for me. Clean up is also a breeze. There were some #2 filters included which was nice to start off with. It also came with a handy note card that lets you know how much ground to water ratio to use. So far it has say perfectly on all of my coffee mugs. Even my wider ones. So I would say this should fit all types of mugs.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Works great, handy, nice when you just want a single cup
customer_reviews.text: I bought a measuring cup to boil the water in the microwave, and then pour it in this unit. It works great, brews a great tasting cup of coffee, and I hand wash it. I also like the lid, which can be used as a lid or a coaster after it has dripped through. Nice, handy little Brewer when you don’t want a full pot.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: The best pour over coffee maker I’ve used. I used to just use the cone shaped coffee “basket” from my coffee maker when I wanted to make a single cup. The Oxo is great because I can pour all the water into the reservoir and cap it to minimize the cooling. You will need to use a bit more coffee/cup than you use in your coffee maker, but the result is very good; better and , less costly than any of the one cup capsules systems.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Idiot-Proof Pourover
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the easiest way to make good, single-cup coffee. No need to haggle with a gooseneck kettle and a tricky pour pattern. Way easier to clean than a french press or Aeropress. No moving parts to trap moisture or stale coffee. Just easy, tasty java.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I can't live without coffee but no one else in my house drinks it. I didn't want a keurig and wanted to ditch my old school coffee maker pot. This makes a perfect single cup of coffee, is super easy to clean and takes up almost no space.
customer_reviews.author: FoxHole

customer_reviews.title: The BEST single  cup maker I have ever used and I have a collection.
customer_reviews.text: This works wonderful and is the best I've used for a single cup of coffee using regular coffee. I need one for the office and I came shopping to see if I could maybe find one with a glass drip chamber. I read a bunch of reviews and determined that if it is not broken - don't try to fix it. I'm ordering my second one today.
customer_reviews.author: emmahrrcn

customer_reviews.title: This makes delicious coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean, makes great coffee. After years of loyalty to my small French press, I bought this for my dad and he loved it so much I got one for myself. You do have to use a little bit more coffee than in the French presss to get it strong enough, but it really makes a smooth delicious brew and does not require too many steps on my uncaffeinated morning-brain.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Frame

customer_reviews.title: Simplest way to make great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: Really the best coffee option for people who are the only coffee drinker in their house our lives alone. I have used French press, aero press, americano (espresso), coffee machines, and this little guy makes the best version of a drip coffee without the duff of needing to make a whole pot, without the weird flavors of the various presses, and without having to commit to having a machine on your counter plugged in all the time. This thing is a coffee loving minimalist’s dream come true.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OXO came up with the better pour over
customer_reviews.text: A lot depends on the quality of the coffee that you buy and the grind you use, but this makes a wonderful cup of coffee. Very smooth, strong and piping hot. After experimenting with several mixes of beans (I ended up using 1 tblsp each of of Sumatra Lintong, Columbian & Brazilian-that are ground for a paper cone to 10 oz of water-), this made the best tasting cup of coffee I've ever made----a cup to savor. I drink it black. Very easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: howboy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent functioning.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. If you are a pour over person, you won’t find a better product. Pour and forget. Mine drains all the water in 5 minutes while I cook my eggs or whatever. Easy clean up, well made.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget_man.

customer_reviews.author: Joe Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great idea!
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should and DOES allow you to walk away while the coffee is brewing rather than standing and adding water bit by bit. I took off a star as I guess my cups are mostly larger than 12 ounces so i would love a little room for more water.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth N.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely makes a better cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I use my OXO pour over coffee maker every day at the office. The reservoir is the secret to better tasting coffee because it slow drips the water over the grounds allowing for a much richer cup of coffee as opposed to just dumping the water directly on the grounds which results in watered down coffee. I like to experiment with different brands of coffee and scoop sizes to find the perfect brew.
customer_reviews.author: Keek, An Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: This is now a must for any travel. Perfect for camping. Light and easy to pack. Easy to use. Not sure if this is intended but when I’m ready to drink it a few drips still come out so I used the lid part as a plate to catch drips.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Heat the water pour it in. Light sturdy plastic with a measuring cup at the top. No problems. Play with it and you can figure out how to get it to your liking strength wise—I like this more than the timed coffeemaker at home.
customer_reviews.author: John R Gentil

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy,little, non-breakable,no babysitting necessary -- I love it!
customer_reviews.text: The holes in the clear plastic pushes the water so that the grounds are soaked in a pre-determined pattern. Just pour hot water in the clear plastic which sits on top of the grounds holder. This gadget doesn't break or require complicated cleaning steps.
customer_reviews.author: golitely

customer_reviews.title: I really needed this!
customer_reviews.text: I am not super particular about coffee, but it was embarrassing that I could never make a consistently decent cup. Nor did I have the patience to stand there spiraling hot water over the grounds for several minutes! This is an excellent fix for those problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tashi

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I have always had trouble with Melitta-type filter cones, because it's hard to judge exactly how much boiling water I'm pouring over the grounds. My coffee often ended up weak. I like this system, because it has a measured water reservoir. It also has a lid that keeps the water hot while it's dripping through. My coffee turns out much more consistent with it.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Use a large cup to prevent overflow
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about you, but I want my first cup of coffee in the morning to be as large as possible. So I would pour to the top and often would have overflow because my cup was too small. I now use a coffee tankard and that solves the problem. I pour the water fast into the reservoir and to the very, very top before slapping on the lid. This little pour over coffee maker is a brilliant design. It understands that we're very busy in the morning and just don't have the time to watch water drip through a coffee maker. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: CWM
